intro: Rubus vindobonensis, commonly known as the Austrian bramble, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is native to Central Europe, particularly Austria, Germany, and parts of France. The plant is a shrub with thorny stems and compound leaves, typically growing to a height of 1–2 meters. Its flowers are white or pale pink, and it produces edible berries that are similar to blackberries. This species is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils, showcasing its adaptability to various environments.
